ovdesc.p: PD PD.CAPTURE PD.CAPTURE
INTEREST.KEY
Contains the key to the BASIC.RATE.TEXT table and subsequently the BASIC.INTEREST table, which indicates the interest rate to be applied. Either this field or INTEREST.RATE must be input.
Up to 4 numeric characters. Must be a valid entry on the BASIC.RATE.TEXT table. Cannot contain a value if INTEREST.RATE is not null. Must contain a value if INTEREST.KEY is null.
INTEREST.RATE
Defines the fixed rate of interest of the underlying loan contract specified in the CONTRACT.NUMBER field. Either this field or INTEREST.KEY must be input.

Up to 11 numeric type R characters including optional decimal point. Input must be greater than 0. Input cannot be greater than 100. Cannot contain a value if INTEREST.KEY is not null. Must contain a value if INTEREST.KEY is null.
LIMIT.REFERENCE

Defines the Limit Reference number of the PD.PAYMENT.DUE contract to be raised. This field is automatically defaulted by the system if the field CONTRACT.NUMBER contains a valid loan contract ID. If the CONTRACT.NUMBER field contains a value of "NEW", then the system will try to default a limit reference number if the CUSTOMER and CURRENCY fields contain valid input.

3-10 numeric characters LIMIT.REFERENCE code. (Defaulted by system, or Mandatory input). Must be a valid LIMIT.REFERENCE number. Mandatory input if CONTRACT.NUMBER field contains "NEW", otherwise defaulted from underlying loan.
LOCAL.REF
Identifies any local reference field(s) defined by the user. Identifies any additional element which has been defined locally to meet a particular requirement. This is a multivalue field.
Up to 35 characters as defined in the local table definition for this local reference field. (Multivalue field). Optional or mandatory input according to the LOCAL.TABLE definition for this field.
NARRATIVE
Allows any narrative to be input for user information. This is a multivalued multilanguage field.
Up to 35 type A alphanumeric characters. (Optional input).
ROUNDING.RULE
This field will hold Product level rounding rule penalty interest calculations. For detailed options on different rounding options help text on EB.ROUNDING.RULE file can be referred.
Should be a valid EB.ROUNDING.RULE id.
ACCRUAL.PARAM
This field will hold Product level valid EB.ACCRUAL.PARAM id
NEXT.PD.ID

Defines the ID to the PD.PAYMENT.DUE record which will be raised if the CONTRACT.NUMBER field contains a value of "NEW". This field is automatically defaulted upon validation of the PD.CAPTURE contract, as long as a record for "PD.PAYMENT.DUE" is set up on the AUTO.ID.START table.
14 alphanumeric characters. (Noinput field). Field is only populated if CONTRACT.NUMBER field contains a value of "NEW".
OUTSTANDING.BAL
Defines the amount which is outstanding on the underlying loan contract specified in the CONTRACT.NUMBER field. This amount is used in the calculation of penalty interest.
Up to 19 numeric type AMT characters. (Mandatory input).
OVERRIDE

Contains all the Override messages which the user agreed to during Input. During the validation of a contract, the system may provide the user with a series of screen override messages to indicate an anomaly, for instance, the repayment date is not a working day. In the event that the user confirms the Override, the full text of the actual Override Message will be stored, for reference purposes only, in this multivalue field. In the example given above when the deal is validated a warning bell will sound and a message will appear, at the foot of the screen, which reads: "VALUE DATE IS NOT A WORKING DAY" This will draw the user's attention to the account entered, which may be a mistake and can then be corrected, alternatively the input may be correct in which case the user must confirm the input. If, subsequently, the contract record is either fully displayed or printed then all override messages raised during the input of that version of the contract will be displayed. This is a multivalue field.
Up to 35 alphanumeric type A characters. (Multivalue field). Noinput field.
PAYMENT.AMT
Specifies the amount overdue for the type in the corresponding PAYMENT.TYPE field. This field is part of an associated multivalue set.
Up to 19 numeric type AMT characters. (Mandatory input. Associated multivalue field).
PAYMENT.TYPE
Indicates the type of payment which is overdue. This field is part of an associated multivalue set.
2 alphanumeric type A characters. (Mandatory input. Associated multivalue field). Must be a valid entry on the PD.AMOUNT.TYPE file. The values allowed are "PR", "IN", "CH", "CO" and "TX".
ACCOUNT.OFFICER

Identifies the Account Officer or Department responsible for the relationship with the counterparty for the PD.PAYMENT.DUE contract to be raised. This field is automatically defaulted by the system if the field CONTRACT.NUMBER contains a valid loan contract ID. If the CONTRACT.NUMBER field contains a value of "NEW", then the system will try to default the Account Officer if the CUSTOMER field contains valid input. It is used by the Management Information System (M.I.S.) for the determination of the Customer Profitability Analysis.

1-4 digit numeric characters. (Defaulted by system, or Mandatory input). Must be a valid code on the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER table. Mandatory input if CONTRACT.NUMBER field contains "NEW", otherwise defaulted from underlying loan.
PD.LOC.REF.DATA

Specifies the data to be input to the LOCAL.REFERENCE field defined in PD.LOC.REF.NO. The contents of this field will be placed in the corresponding local reference field on the PD.PAYMENT.DUE contract created or updated. The input must of course match the requirements for the local reference field defined on LOCAL.TABLE.

Up to 35 characters as defined in the LOCAL.TABLE definition for the LOCAL.REFERENCE field whose position is in PD.LOC.REF.NO. (Optional or mandatory input if corresponding PD.LOC.REF.NO input. Associated multivalue field).
PD.LOC.REF.NO

Specifies the LOCAL.REFERENCE element to be used defined for the PD.PAYMENT.DUE application on the LOCAL.REF.TABLE file by it's position. The contents of this field identify the LOCAL.REFERENCE element to be used. It must be one that is defined on LOCAL.REF.TABLE for the PD.PAYMENT.DUE application.
1 - 3 numeric characters. (Optional Input. Associated multivalue field).
PORTFOLIO.NUMBER

Defines the Customer Portfolio Number for which the PD.PAYMENT.DUE contract is to be raised. This field is automatically defaulted by the system if the field CONTRACT.NUMBER contains a valid loan contract ID.

Up to 3 numeric characters. (Optional input). Any input will be validated against the SEC.ACC.MASTER file. Optional input if CONTRACT.NUMBER field contains "NEW", otherwise defaulted from underlying loan if present.
POSITION.TYPE
Identifies the Position Type applicable to the PD.PAYMENT.DUE contract to be raised. This field is automatically defaulted by the system to the value of "TR" (trading).

2 alphanumeric characters. (System default value is "TR"). Must be a valid code on the FX.POS.TYPE table. Optional input if CONTRACT.NUMBER field contains "NEW", otherwise defaulted from underlying loan.

SETTLEMENT.ACCT

Identifies the account which is to be credited for the corresponding payment type and amount. The account must be in the same currency as that defined in the CURRENCY field. This field is part of an associated multivalue set. In case the underlying Contract Customer (eg. Customer.id in MONEYMARKET,Counterparty in FOREX, etc.) has a record in CUSTOMER.SSI application, then the account number in this field gets defaulted as per the definition for that Customer from CUSTOMER.SSI.For more information on the usage of this feature please refer to CUSTOMER.SSI application.

1-16 numeric characters relating to a Customer account or a Nostro account. (Mandatory input. Associated multivalue field). Must be a valid entry on the ACCOUNT table. Must be of the same currency as defined in the CURRNECY field.
STMT.NO

A number generated automatically by the system which identifies either a statement entry or a category entry in respect of the PD contract. Whenever an amendment to, or input of, a contract requires an accounting entry to be raised, this field will record the IDs of the entries generated. The IDs to accounting entries, both STMT.ENTRYs and CATEG.ENTRYs, consist of a date-time stamp and a sequence number. All entries raised by a particular input/transaction will have the same date-time stamp but different sequence numbers. This field has three multivalues, the first contains the base date-time stamp which is common to all entries. The second contains the sequence numbers of the STMT.ENTRYs raised and the third the sequence numbers of any CATEG.ENTRYs. Whenever a contract is viewed using the (S)ee function this field will show the entry IDs that were raised by that version of the contract only. If the amendment made on a particular version did not raise any entries, then the field will be blank. Any end of day processing which raises accounting entries will also update this field and write a history record. This is a multivalue field.
Up to 29 alphanumeric characters. (Multivalue field). Noinput field.
TOTAL.OVERDUE.AMT

Defines the total amount which is overdue. This is the sum of all the amounts in the field PAYMENT.AMT. This field is automatically updated by the system whenever any input is made to the PAYMENT.AMT field.
Noinput field.
VALUE.DATE

Specifies the date on which the payment became overdue. This date must be prior or equal to today's date and may even be before the value date of the underlying loan contract specified in the CONTRACT.NUMBER field.
11 type D characters - standard date format. (Mandatory input). Date entered must be less than or equal to today's date.
CONTRACT.NUMBER

Specifies the ID of the underlying loan for which a PD.PAYMENT.DUE contract is being raised, or in case there is no underlying loan a value of "NEW" must be input. The input to this field must be a valid contract on either the SWAP, LD.LOANS.AND.DEPOSITS, MM.MONEY.MARKET or MG.MORTGAGE files or a value of "NEW".

14 type A alphanumeric characters. (Mandatory input). Must be a valid entry on either the SWAP, LD.LOANS.AND.DEPOSITS, MM.MONEY.MARKET or MG.MORTGAGE files if the input is not "NEW". The underlying contract must be a loan type (not deposit) if the field contains a loan contract number. If the underlying contract is a SWAP then it must contain, or be, an asset side.
CURRENCY
Defines the Currency of the PD.PAYMENT.DUE contract to be raised. This field is automatically defaulted by the system if the the field CONTRACT.NUMBER contains a valid loan contract ID.

3 type SSS characters (uppercase alpha) or, 1 to 3 numeric character currency code. (Defaulted by system, or Mandatory input). Must be a valid Currency code on the CURRENCY table. Mandatory input if CONTRACT.NUMBER field contains "NEW", otherwise defaulted from underlying loan.
CURRENCY.MARKET
Defines the Currency Market of the PD.PAYMENT.DUE contract to be raised. This field is automatically defaulted by the system to the value of "1".

Up to 2 numeric digits Currency Market code. (System default value is "1"). Must be a valid code on the CURRENCY.MARKET table. Optional input if CONTRACT.NUMBER field contains "NEW", otherwise defaulted from underlying loan.
CUSTOMER
Defines the Customer of the PD.PAYMENT.DUE contract to be raised. This field is automatically defaulted by the system if the field CONTRACT.NUMBER contains a valid loan contract ID.

3-10 alphanumeric customer mnemonic or, 1-10 numeric character customer number. (Defaulted by system, or Mandatory input). Must be a valid Customer number or mnemonic on the CUSTOMER table. Mandatory input if CONTRACT.NUMBER field contains "NEW", otherwise defaulted from underlying loan.
DEALER.DESK

Identifies the Dealer Desk relating to the PD.PAYMENT.DUE contract to be raised. This field is automatically defaulted by the system if the field CONTRACT.NUMBER contains a valid loan contract ID. If the underlying loan contract is a LD or MG type, then a value of "00" will be defaulted. If the CONTRACT.NUMBER field contains a value of "NEW", then the system will default this field to a value of "00". This code is used to maintain position at the dealer desk level.

2 alphanumeric character dealer code in the range "A-Z", "a-z" plus "0-9". (System default value is "00"). Must be a valid entry on the DEALER.DESK table. Optional input if CONTRACT.NUMBER field contains "NEW", otherwise defaulted from underlying loan.
ID

The unique reference number by which a PD.CAPTURE contract is identified. This number is assigned when the contract is first entered into the system. This can be done either manually or automatically by use of the F3 key, providing auto IDs have been specified on the COMPANY record.
14 character reference number comprised of: "PDCA" application identifier, followed by 5 digit Julian date without century, followed by 5 digit sequence number. (Mandatory input).
INTEREST.BASIS

Defines the Interest Day Basis which indicates the calculation method to be used for interest amount calculations for the PD.PAYMENT.DUE contract to be raised. This field is automatically defaulted by the system if the field CONTRACT.NUMBER contains a valid loan contract ID. Can accept one of the following types, dependant on the underlying deal: Key Days/Denominator A 360/360 A1 360/360* A2 360/360* B 366/360 C C2 Act/Act ISDA Act/Act AFB D 360/366 E 366/365 F 360/365 F1 360/365* F2 360/365* S Special For illustrations of all supported INTEREST.BASIS see INTEREST.BASIS

1-2 alphanumeric characters. (Defaulted by system, or Mandatory input). Must be a valid entry on the INTEREST.BASIS table. Mandatory input if CONTRACT.NUMBER field contains "NEW", otherwise defaulted from underlying loan.

This field will hold Product level valid EB.ACCRUAL.PARAM id
